skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.
skill.summary: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regressio...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Reviewed 14 text files with documentation and example snippets only. No executable scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable usage were found.

content.user_title: Choose aeon methods for time series tasks
content.value_statement: Time series workflows involve many model choices. This skill guides selection and provides aeon examples for common tasks.
actual_capabilities: List aeon classifiers and when to use each
Summarize clustering and similarity search options
Provide forecasting and anomaly detection examples
limitations: Requires the aeon Python package to run code
Does not execute training or evaluation
Does not access or load user data

use_cases.title: Select a model
use_cases.description: Choose suitable aeon algorithms for labeled or unlabeled time series tasks.

use_cases.title: Design a pipeline
use_cases.description: Plan preprocessing and feature extraction steps using aeon transformers.

use_cases.title: Survey methods
use_cases.description: Review available algorithms for forecasting, anomalies, or segmentation.

prompt_templates.title: Pick a classifier
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend an aeon classifier for a small labeled dataset and explain the speed and accuracy tradeoffs.

prompt_templates.title: Plan a forecast
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline an aeon forecasting approach and list the first parameters I should tune.

prompt_templates.title: Detect anomalies
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest aeon anomaly detectors for point and subsequence anomalies and explain when to use each.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced features
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a feature extraction pipeline with aeon transformers and how to pass features into a scikit-learn classifier.

output_examples.input: Help me choose a fast time series classifier for a small dataset
output: Recommend MiniRocketClassifier for speed and strong accuracy
Validate with a simple train and test split

best_practices: Normalize series before distance based methods
Start with ROCKET variants as a strong baseline
Validate with a held out split and simple metrics
anti_patterns: Using deep models on very small datasets
Skipping normalization for distance based models
Tuning many models without a baseline check

faq.question: Is this compatible with Python and scikit-learn?
faq.answer: Yes. Aeon uses scikit-learn compatible APIs and runs in Python environments.

faq.question: What data sizes work best?
faq.answer: Small and medium datasets suit distance and ROCKET methods. Deep learning needs larger datasets.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with sklearn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Aeon transformers and estimators are designed to work in sklearn pipelines.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or data?
faq.answer: No. It provides guidance and examples without accessing local files or data.

faq.question: What if results are poor?
faq.answer: Check normalization, try a simpler baseline, and tune key parameters like window size or kernels.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic ML tools?
faq.answer: Aeon provides time series specific models and distances that generic tools do not include.
